thread.title: Freshman goalie registers shutout in Union hockey debut
thread.title_full: Freshman goalie registers shutout in Union hockey debut - Times Union

author: Sean Martin
title: Freshman goalie registers shutout in Union hockey debut
text:
Schenectady
Jake Kupsky admitted to being nervous when he took the Messa Rink ice for his first game as a Union hockey player.
But no one else could tell Kupsky had a case of nerves, because the freshman from Waukesha, Wis., was calm, cool and collected in registering a shutout in Union's 2-0 win over Maine on Saturday in non-conference play.
Kupsky, who found out prior to the team's 11 a.m. video session that he'd be making his debut, turned aside the 26 shots he faced.
"Coming into the game, pretty nervous obviously being the first college game," Kupsky said. "I had a lot of faith in our team, and I didn't have too many chances that were point blank or anything like that. So coming out of there with zero goals against was a team expectation, and we followed through with that tonight."
Union head coach Rick Bennett was pleased with the play of his freshman goaltender.
"That was a breath of fresh air. To see Jake go in there in his first game is pretty rewarding," Bennett said. "You just never know. I guess the old crystal ball was working, and tonight it worked out well for us."
More Information
Union 2, Maine 0
Maine 0 0 0 — 0
Union 0 0 2 — 2
First Period – No scoring. Penalties – Perez, Mai, (hooking), 13:30; Ammirato, Uni, (elbowing), 18:40.
Second Period – No scoring. Penalties – Lichtenwald, Uni, (slashing), 1:59.
Third Period – 1. Union, Gingras 1, (Hynes, B. Taylor), 5:26; 2. Union, Vecchione 1, (Gingras), 15:00;
Penalties – Dufour, Uni, (slashing), 2:51; Campbell, Mai, (slashing), 7:36.
Shots On Goal –Maine 4-10-x-xx; Union 11-11-x-xx Power Play Opportunities –Maine 0 for 3, Union 0 for 2 Goalies Maine – Matt Morris (0-1-1) (33 shots-31 saves) Union – Jake Kupsky (1-0-0) (26 shots-26 saves)
T: 2:05; A-2,002
The first two periods featured a goaltending dual between Kupsky and Maine netminder Matt Morris , as neither team scored in the first 40 minutes.
Kupsky had four big stops in the second, including a save on Steven Swavely 's rebound attempt at point-blank range with 3:15 left in the second. A minute later, he flashed his left pad to deny Brady Campbell to keep the game scoreless.
Union (2-0-2) finally broke the ice when defenseman Sebastian Gingras ' shot from the right point through a screen beat Morris at 5:26 of the third period.
Freshman Brendan Thomas provided the chaos in front of the Maine goaltender, allowing Gingras' shot to find the back of the net.
"At this level, you've got to have guys in front of the net if you want to score goals," Gingras said. "I think it was Taylor there, he goes to the net and gave him a great screen. Otherwise, that shot probably doesn't go in on good goalies like that."
Gingras' goal withstood an official's review, as Taylor had made contact with Morris's stick. But it was ruled a goal due to Morris's stick being out of the crease.
Union kept up the pressure on Maine (0-1-3) and made it 2-0 when Mike Vecchione ripped a wrist shot by Morris with five minutes to play for his first goal of the season.
The play was started by Gingras and finished by the Dutchmen co-captain.
Vecchione skated into the right circle flanked by a pair of Black Bear defensemen.
"I had a full head of steam," he said. "I came from our d-zone all the way down. I was going down on a one-on-two and I knew I probably wasn't going to beat both guys. As soon as the D moved over, I just ripped it."
Sean Martin , a local freelance writer, is a frequent contributor to the Times Union .
